snippet: A careful guide to wine grapes and a history of winemaking in Australia are among the latest books for the serious oenophile.
abstract: Eric Asimov The Pour column recommends books Wine Grapes by Jancis Robinson, Sherry, Manzanilla and Montilla by Peter Liem and Jesus Barquin and The History of Australian WIne by Max Allen; observes that each book will appeal primarily to those who are already well grounded in basics, but anybody who is curious and willing to make investment will find books highly useful.
lead_paragraph: A careful guide to wine grapes and a history of winemaking in Australia are among the latest books for the serious oenophile.

headline.print_headline: Like Having Sommeliers on Your Bookshelf
headline.seo: For Wine Enthusiasts, a Few New Reference Books
headline.main: Highlights From the 2012 Vintage in Wine Publishing
